page.title: 10CHILDREN'S WORRIES
page.content: A survey was conducted amongst 14 year old children at Theale Green School during July 1985 to establish what they were concerned or worried about. Considering the number of nuclear related sites in the area, it is not surprising that the most overwhelming fear was that of a nuclear war. Almost every child was deeply worried about this. Schoolwork was the second greatest concern of the children. This was followed - in order of concern - by relations with friends, the environment ( in particular the increasing housing and industry in the area ), relations with parents, fear of getting a serious disease, worries about getting a job and concern for the well-being of their pets. There was no marked difference in the responses of boys and girls in this survey.
